entities.name: firebolt
entities.description: The Firebolt is a gift to Harry, described as 'perfectly smooth, streamlined birch twigs' that make up its tail. It is wrapped in wrappings that Ron rips apart.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the recipient of the Firebolt gift, described as feeling 'stunned' when he receives it. He mentions that Dumbledore sent him the Invisibility Cloak anonymously.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is Harry's friend who helps him unwrap the Firebolt and speculates about who might have sent it to Harry. He thinks Dumbledore is a likely candidate.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as a possible sender of the Firebolt gift, but he denies sending it anonymously in case it would be seen as favoritism. He had previously sent Harry the Invisibility Cloak.

entities.name: invisibility cloak
entities.description: The Invisibility Cloak is a gift from Dumbledore to Harry, described as being passed on to him by his father. It was sent anonymously to avoid favoritism accusations.

entities.name: malfoy
entities.description: Malfoy is mentioned as someone who might accuse Dumbledore of favoritism if he were to send gifts to students. Ron uses his name in a derogatory manner, calling him a 'git'.

entities.name: dursleys
entities.description: The Dursleys are Harry's cruel and neglectful Muggle relatives who are unlikely to have sent the Firebolt gift. Harry mentions that it wasn't them.

relationships.description: Dumbledore is described as sending the Invisibility Cloak to Harry anonymously, and Ron speculates that he might have sent the Firebolt gift as well.
Dumbledore is described as sending the Invisibility Cloak to Harry, passing it on from his father.
Harry receives the Firebolt gift, which is described as being sent to him by an unknown sender.
